items.title: Calls for universal vision screening tests for all SA preschool children
items.summary: A group of researchers is calling on the South Australian government to implement a universal vision screening program for all children attending preschools or day care centres.

items.title: Man who failed to remove backyard cheese facility told to pay $120,000
items.summary: An Adelaide retiree who continually ignored orders to remove an unauthorised backyard cheesemaking facility from his suburban home is ordered to pay more than $120,000 in costs, after being found guilty of contempt of court.

items.title: Fact or fiction: Did infamous child killers spark the end of Sydney's Macdonaldtown?
items.summary: It's the suburb in Sydney that no longer exists — except for a train station — but did it disappear because of scandalous murders or was it just to increase property prices?

items.title: Inside the 'dark, deadly' US mission to capture Nicolás Maduro at his compound in Caracas
items.summary: Fresh details about the operation to detain Venezuelan President Nicolás Maduro and his wife on Saturday have been revealed, and even Donald Trump's top military advisor has described the mission as "audacious".

items.title: Alex de Minaur unfazed by United Cup loss to Casper Ruud in Australian Open build-up
items.summary: Alex de Minaur is not concerned about his Australian Open preparations, believing he can "flip that switch" after recording his first career defeat to Casper Ruud.

items.title: Tourists stranded, dozens of roads closed as rain continues in flooded outback Queensland
items.summary: Tourists are stranded in towns dotted across north-west Queensland as rain continues to keep major rivers in flood.

items.title: Donald Trump says US will run Venezuela for now after Nicolás Maduro's capture
items.summary: The US will temporarily run Venezuela after American forces captured the country's president and first lady in an extraordinary military strike, US President Donald Trump says.

items.title: Blak romance surges as First Nations authors rewrite love stories with 'choc-lit'
items.summary: An anthology of love stories written by First Nations people is in the works with stories of blak love, joy, and connection capitalising on the fastest growing literary genre in the world.

items.title: Pakistan's first woman to summit K2 sparks new wave of female climbers
items.summary: Pakistani women are hiking some of the world's tallest mountains and glacier trails, claiming a space that has long been out of reach.

items.title: Australian exporters still grappling with 'the wild west' eight months after 'liberation day'
items.summary: From de minimis to beef tariffs, Aussie exporters are preparing for another "wild" year.

items.title: Butter, margarine or nut spreads. Which is best for your home?
items.summary: You might have a personal preference for which spread you use at home, but experts say there are health considerations for which one you use.

items.title: Today in History, January 4: How 'arrogant' Edmund Hillary made history again at the South Pole
items.summary: Less than five years after conquering Mount Everest, legendary explorer Sir Edmund Hillary wanted to make history again in Antarctica.

items.title: ABC Places quiz: Travel around the world from your chair
items.summary: Your task in the ABC Places quiz is to correctly identify the location shown in each of 10 photos. Grab your passport and let's go.

items.title: For its 250th birthday, America is being America
items.summary: It is entirely fitting that the US is so splintered on its semiquincentennial. Division, for the lion's share of its history, has been its default.

items.title: Nicolás Maduro was 'captured' by the US military. This is who he is
items.summary: The 63-year-old Venezuelan president was "captured" in a "large-scale strike". Here is what is known about the man set to stand trial on criminal charges in the United States.

items.title: Nick Kyrgios prepared to go through Australian Open qualifying if wildcard spot eludes him
items.summary: Nick Kyrgios describes himself as a "chaotic mess, but an entertainer" as he prepares to return in Brisbane and awaits a call on his Australian Open status.

items.title: AI chatbot Grok under fire over complaints it let users undress minors in photos on X
items.summary: The generative AI chatbot integrated with X is under international scrutiny after reports it was filling the social media platform with sexually explicit images of children and women.

items.title: Hunt for escaped red-whiskered bulbul that has SA's fruitgrowers worried
items.summary: The sighting of a single red-whiskered bulbul in the wild might not seem like a big deal, but this invasive pest could put crops and the environment at risk.

items.title: Australia coy about Cameron Green's role in final Ashes Test against England at SCG
items.summary: Steve Smith launches an impassioned defence of the out-of-form Cameron Green, but cannot guarantee the all-rounder's place in Australia's XI for the final Ashes Test.

items.title: Wildlife carers warn people to watch out for puggle burrows this summer
items.summary: With female echidnas seemingly creating burrows in random places at this time of the year, wildlife carers warn to keep an eye out for what might be disturbed while doing holiday work on your property.

items.title: Premium beef producers expect to be the main casualty of China's new 55 per cent tariff
items.summary: Australian cattle farmers producing wagyu and Angus beef are likely to be among the hardest hit by China's 55 per cent tariff on exports exceeding a 205,000-tonne quota.

items.title: Former Darwin councillor's ex-partner speaks out after guilty domestic violence verdict
items.summary: Former Darwin councillor Paul Arnold was found guilty of domestic violence after a years-long court battle, with his ex-partner refusing to be scared into silence. She said the case was "stressful and deeply humiliating", but facing her abuser had been empowering.

items.title: Middle Percy Island is a 'haven' for sailors, displaying scores of memorabilia from bygone days
items.summary: Middle Percy Island is a rare gem where boaties can come ashore and wander through thousands of mementos left by travellers from across the globe.

items.title: WA's Pilbara region shares a human and shorebird FIFO population
items.summary: Dozens of shorebird species flock to northern WA for summer during their global migration.

items.title: Photographs of Men in Love exhibition reveals public glimpses of forbidden love
items.summary: What started as a chance discovery of an old photo at a Dallas antique store has spawned a collection of more than 4,000 images of male couples, more than 100 of which are now on display in Canberra.

items.title: Coffee pods generate thousands of tonnes of waste in Australia. Here's what is being done about it
items.summary: Between 10 and 20 per cent of the 3 million coffee pods Australians consume daily are actually recycled. Here's what's being done to change that.

items.title: Barbecue explosion prompts safety warning after Qld beautician's burns
items.summary: Rachel Dear has a serious warning for anyone using a gas barbecue after she suffered significant face and body burns while cooking on Christmas Eve.

items.title: Police hunt for offenders after shooting in Melbourne's inner north
items.summary: Police are searching for offenders, who are believed to have driven past in a silver SUV and fired shots at a young man, before fleeing the scene.

items.title: Tesla loses title of bestselling EV company to BYD as sales drop
items.summary: Tesla sales have declined for the second consecutive year, with Chinese rival BYD surpassing it as the world's largest electric vehicle maker.

items.title: Naomi Osaka loses United Cup match to Maria Sakkari ahead of Australian Open
items.summary: Just over two weeks from the season-opening major, former world number one Naomi Osaka reveals she is not at full health after contracting a viral illness over the Christmas period.

items.title: Mid North Coast brumby program rehomes 160 wild horses across Australia
items.summary: About a third of the brumby population on the NSW Mid North Coast has been rehomed through a program designed to give wild horses a second chance as pets.

items.title: From a Facebook appreciation group to viral TikTok reviews: Australia's love for bánh mì
items.summary: A humble bánh mì appreciation group created by a Sydneysider has played a pivotal role in reinvigorating Australia's love for Vietnamese baguettes.

items.title: The parts of Myanmar the military junta doesn't want you to see
items.summary: Myanmar's military is holding its first elections since overthrowing a democratically elected government in 2021. But as it aims to portray a sense of normality, signs of the junta's menacing presence are everywhere.

items.title: The moon will loom extra large tonight — but it's not a supermoon
items.summary: Stargazers will be treated with a supersized wolf moon for the first weekend of the year. Here's what to know.

items.title: Red and yellow flags can be dangerously confusing. Is it time to change them?
items.summary: Every summer, millions of Australians head to the beach and every year thousands are rescued by lifeguards or surf life savers, and even surfers or other bystanders.

items.title: World-first as Australian donates organs after self-administering assisted dying medication
items.summary: An Australian woman is believed to have become the first person in the world to donate organs after self-administering oral voluntary assisted dying medication.

items.title: Are reading goals helpful or performative? How to read more in the new year
items.summary: While some people might find goal setting motivating — such as reading X number of books each year or pages each day — there is a risk of turning what is supposed to be a pleasurable activity into a chore.

items.title: Today in History, January 3: Steve Waugh secures a last-ball century to complete his perfect day
items.summary: With one ball remaining on day two of the fifth Ashes Test in 2003, Steve Waugh stared down a century and his own cricketing mortality before securing one of the most famous centuries of his storied career.

items.title: ABC 50/50 quiz: This week we're testing your knowledge of Kylie Minogue, Greek gods and card games

items.title: Albanese government can expect economic and political pressure in 2026
items.summary: What are you watching in Australian politics in 2026? That's the question we put to the ABC's political journalists and columnists.

items.title: Emergency services downgrade bushfire warning for Mundaring residents, Arson squad investigating
items.summary: Police are investigating bushfires reported in the nearby suburbs of Boya and Koongamia, which firefighters bring under control on Saturday.

items.title: WA police scale back search for snorkeller missing since New Year's Day
items.summary: The 32-year-old man, who was part of a group of four divers snorkelling for crayfish, was reported missing off Ledge Point Beach.

items.title: Mother wallaby death sparks animal cruelty investigation in far north Queensland
items.summary: Wildlife carers have lodged formal complaints with police and environment officials after stumbling across a scene involving a dead mother wallaby tied to a signpost.

items.title: Maya Joint hit with illness ahead of Australia's United Cup opener against Norway
items.summary: Australia's teen sensation is forced to lay low, with team captain Lleyton Hewitt hoping it is just a 24-hour thing.

items.title: Todd Murphy in line for Ashes return as SCG curator allays fears over pitch's green exterior
items.summary: Todd Murphy could play his first Test match on Australian soil as the curator of the SCG allays fears over the pitch.

items.title: Donald Trump gave a wide-ranging interview about his health. Here's what we learned
items.summary: US President Donald Trump says he regrets undergoing advanced imagery on his heart and abdomen because of the "ammunition" it handed his critics, but has once more defended his "perfect" health.

items.title: Boddington family watches heritage cottage filled with antiques go up in flames on Christmas Day
items.summary: Two heritage homes and thousands of hectares of land were lost in a Christmas Day bushfire in Boddington.

items.title: Man who kidnapped boy from Moora home given eight-year prison sentence
items.summary: A man who abducted a boy from his bed in regional WA after sniffing butane and having delusions about aliens is sentenced to eight years in prison.

items.title: Man faces court after alleged crime spree, police pursuit in Latrobe Valley
items.summary: A 34-year-old man has been remanded in custody after allegedly going on a multi-day crime spree across Victoria's south-east involving carjackings, burglaries and a police pursuit.

items.title: Venus Williams to become oldest ever Australian Open participant after receiving wildcard
items.summary: Venus Williams will play in the main draw of the Australian Open for the first time since 2021, 28 years after she first graced Melbourne Park.

items.title: Research ties China's smog clean-up to hotter and drier conditions in Australia
items.summary: As China caps off a historic clean-up of its smog and air pollution, the clearer air is helping temperatures rise to new records. Now, researchers are linking that change to hotter and drier conditions in Australia.

items.title: China's beef tariffs aren't personal as economy slows
items.summary: Beijing's new measures are aimed at trying to rein in an Australian surge and manage local growth, rather than a direct target on Australia.

items.title: Tennant Creek mother who died in police watch house described as well-respected and bubbly
items.summary: A remote outback town is searching for answers about why a “respectful, friendly and bubbly” Aboriginal mother died in the police watch house, more than 24 hours after her Christmas Day arrest.

items.title: Usman Khawaja did it all his own way and retires a modern day Australian cricket great
items.summary: Before his debut in 2011, Australia had never seen a cricketer like Usman Khawaja and, thanks to his work on and off the field, he'll be followed by plenty more.

items.title: As Zohran Mamdani becomes New York's mayor, what are his chances of success?
items.summary: New York's new mayor, Zohran Mamdani, has vowed not to water down his ambitious agenda during an impassioned inauguration address outside City Hall. But is his vision achievable?

items.title: Truck driver shortage looms as industry looks to refresh an aging workforce
items.summary: Australia's road transport industry is facing a growing driver shortage driven by an aging workforce and limited recruitment of younger people.

items.title: Unique 'mugging' behaviour attracts intrigued whale watchers to Queensland hotspot
items.summary: People normally try to avoid getting mugged, but when it comes to being mugged by humpback whales, sightseers are travelling to Queensland's whale-watching capital to witness this special event.

items.title: Usman Khawaja takes aim at 'racial stereotypes' during retirement announcement ahead of fifth Ashes Test
items.summary: Australia batter Usman Khawaja takes aim at his critics one last time as he announces his retirement from international cricket.

items.title: Could modular and prefabricated homes be the key to solving the ACT's housing crisis?
items.summary: Fast to build, eco-friendly and affordable: modular and pre-fabricated homes have been touted as a possible solution to Australia's housing crisis, but manufacturers and suppliers say changes are needed to reduce costs and meet demand.
